intro: Reseda lutea var. filiformis, commonly known as the slender yellowweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences. The species is known for its adaptability to harsh environments and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
